body_html:
For experimentation you may just want to change the kernel implementation to use another library. For example, change the MatMul kernel implementation to use another library.

The "Adding an op" guide would be a useful read to provide background on ops and kernels.

If you get more sophisticated, you could try things like what is done for Intel MKL where a graph rewrite pass updates the nodes in the graph so that MKL-enabled kernels are used.

I don't believe that we (TensorFlow team) has any in-progress efforts for writing kernel implementations using the libraries you mentioned, but @tatianashp would have a more authoritative answer.

Hope that helps.

(Closing this since this isn't a bug or feature request. Feel free to reopen if I misunderstood)

body:
For experimentation you may just want to change the kernel implementation to use another library. For example, change the [`MatMul` kernel](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.7/tensorflow/core/kernels/matmul_op.cc) implementation to use another library.

The ["Adding an op"](https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op) guide would be a useful read to provide background on ops and kernels.

If you get more sophisticated, you could try things like what is done for Intel MKL where [a graph rewrite pass](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.7/tensorflow/core/graph/mkl_layout_pass.cc#L49) updates the nodes in the graph so that MKL-enabled kernels are used.

I don't believe that we (TensorFlow team) has any in-progress efforts for writing kernel implementations using the libraries you mentioned, but @tatianashp would have a more authoritative answer. 

Hope that helps.

(Closing this since this isn't a bug or feature request. Feel free to reopen if I misunderstood)
